website_summaries.verdict: Buy the Bonavita Immersion Dripper for single cups of excellent coffee but stay away if you're unwilling to work a little.
pros: The Bonavita Immersion Dripper makes rich, intensely delicious cups of coffee
It's one single unit that's easy to clean by hand and dishwasher safe
Its filter cone is constructed from porcelain that feels more luxurious than plastic
It has a physical lever to turn the flow of coffee on and off
cons: It takes some practice to use this coffee maker properly
For the best and most consistent results you'll need to use it with a quality coffee grinder, accurate scale and electric kettle with variable temperature settings
It's more expensive than other single-cup pour over brewers

customer_reviews.title: Mine broke too!
customer_reviews.text: Two months and it broke. I should have realized, having read the negative reviews, that the design is flawed and the OPEN/CLOSE lever will break eventually (sooner rather than later). I didn’t abuse it. I just used it normally. I rinsed it after each use and washed it on the top shelf in the dishwasher once a week. I bought this naïvely thinking the manufacturer surely would have corrected this design flaw as soon as they knew it was a problem. Instead, you have to ask them for a replacement part and fix it yourself. The concept for this product is great. I love the ceramic bowl. I hate the cheap plastic lever.
customer_reviews.author: cuddlecool

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really love this coffee maker. I've been using a French press for years and am just sick of cleaning it. I'm a bit hesitant to make the full transition to pourover and this is a great gateway drug. One maintenance note: I see a lot of people saying they put it in the dishwasher. I also see many having issues with the plastic lever wearing out/breaking. I'm guessing these are related. Nowhere does it say this product is dishwasher safe. I simply rinse it out in hot water and let it drain between uses. Don't put it in your dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley K. Bolin

customer_reviews.title: Great product idea but durability of materials is a problem
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of these. I love the concept of being able to control how long I can steep the coffee. But sooner or later, the plastic lever at the bottom will break, no matter how careful you are. The first time it broke (within a year) I contacted Bonavita, and they did replace the whole unit. But since then I've had two more units, and the levers broke on these as well. Bonavita would have a terrific product here if they could address the durability of the lever. But once it breaks, this dripper is no different from any other dripper out there. And again, let me stress that sooner or later, that lever will break.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but the leaking is a show stopper for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Bonavita as a replacement for my Clever Coffee Dripper which broke after two years. The open/close lever is nice, the porcelain is easy to clean and it looked like it might last forever until... It started leaking... After only 1 month. It looks to me like there is a problem with the little rubber piece that acts as the stopper on the close lever. If I don't leave the device sitting on top of my cup, there is coffee all over cabinet. Maybe i just got a defective one but at this point, I can't recommend it. And I am past the 30 day return window. Quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of these and the lever has broken on all of them.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 3 of these and the lever has broken on all of them! it is a wonderful device for immersion coffee when you first get it but the first two broke within the first year and the latest broke in the first 3mo. The latest also leaks when its supposed to be closed. I am very disappointed because this is the only non plastic version of this type of dripper i can find.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It took me awhile to find one of these that actually had the stopper. Makes such a huge difference, because you can actually let the coffee steep/brew for 3 minutes (or however long you need) and then release. It also comes with a lid which keeps it hot during that process. My only complaint (not even really a complaint) is that the bottom exposes all of the inner workings of the device. So water definitely gets inside (and possibly trapped) so it takes a bit to air dry. They should find a way to cover all the screws and nooks and crannies. Other that that, it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie T

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen staple
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these, the first purchased based on a blogger's review of his home system. The first one lasted for years but someone finally dropped it on our tile floor and we didn't think twice about buying a replacement. I like this type because it has the stop drip and that means I can get a good bloom and even some steep time before releasing the brew into the vessel below. I have an electric brewer and still consider this a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Ms GadgetTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: nice gizmo, but broke too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have a plastic version with a "pressure" sort of release valve--the coffee would blow when you set the filter on you cup. I like the ceramic version, as it retains heat. Not sure if the on-off valve is better or worse. It's easy to forget to switch it back to block flow, like when you rinse the thing. (The plastic one's vale started to leak after a while.) On this one, there's a fairly stiff plastic band that apparently binds the funnel and base together. Mine cracked after about 4 months, and now there's a slow leak. ...
customer_reviews.author: JeffBoham

customer_reviews.title: Failure on first use
customer_reviews.text: First time I tried to use this it l asked where th ceramic meets th plastic base and th valve leaked when closed. After this short lived experiment going to buy another Clever dripper
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Mine broke too and there are no replacement parts!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cold brew drinker, but got this gadget for my mother to use when she's visiting. It was great until it broke. Looks like a common problem. They wouldn't sell me a replacement lever. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Perfection ....a delicious cup o' joe.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and tried it out immediately. Off the charts fabulous. If you like a french press/pour through type brew this is for you. I have been using a clever coffee brand maker that is a bit like this. The clever is plastic and this is porcelain. The bonavita also has a control lever. Easy easy easy to use. I don't have the deal with the mess of a french press. This is a single serve type maker. I highly recommend it. The porcelain definitely makes a better cup of coffee compared to plastic.
customer_reviews.author: kimeepoo60

customer_reviews.title: Back to coffee basics
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative. Love the ceramic. After years of loving my pod brewer, I started to be aware of the daily plastic waste. We went back to an old fashioned percolator, but that was a hassle. This immersion brewer is the answer! High quality coffee, no sediment, and I dispose of the grounds and filters in a compost pile. Also, I like choosing the brew time for stronger flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE ... Company Replaced Entire Unit ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE to Earlier Review Posted below .... After the review below, a total replacement showed up in the mail. So, Thank you! Here's hoping this one lasts! Looking forward to a great cup of coffee again! ------ Do not waste your money. Worked great for a couple months and then started leaking from the bottom ... until the stopper finally just broke in half. Called the company & emailed a couple of times to get a replacement stopper. No response. Sad because it's a great product while it works ... and now it's basically just a crappy pour over because it pours out immediately. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: VIA

customer_reviews.title: vs. the Clever Drip
customer_reviews.text: Definitely superior to the Clever Dripper that I have been using the past 2 years. However, if you have a travel thermos like the famous Zojirushi, it does not nestle well on the small diameter rim. EDIT: few weeks later I should not that it doesn't hold as many ounces as the zojirushi no matter what the specifications say. Also as the rate of flow decreases, it stops dripping on center and runs somewhere along the inner rim. This is extremely frustrating for any smaller diameter cups or travel thermoses and really creates a mess.
customer_reviews.author: LAZERDEATHKILL

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but drip hole is too small
customer_reviews.text: This works, and it isn't plastic, so that's a plus. It doesn't balance particularly well on top of cups or carafes and I'm always close to knocking it over. The drip hole is smaller than some of the others on the market and that sometimes slows down the brewing time. More than 4 minutes to finish dripping and you'll have a mediocre and bitter cup of coffee. I like the Hario V60 better because it has a larger hold and is a little more stable when sitting on top of a carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Leed61

customer_reviews.title: Open/Close tab broke in 3 weeks and then again on replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was enjoying this product, until the open/close tab broke. I've had the dripper only about 3 weeks. I have ordered a replacement & will update this review if the next one lasts longer. Update: the tab on the replacement broke in just over 6 months. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: This product has 2 problems...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Clever. I didn’t want to purchase plastic. Of course what little plastic this product has, has broken. I have not used this coffee maker regularly. It seems to have a design flaw, where the stopper arm is pinched down at a hefty spring. If you first wet the sides of the filter, the shape of the ceramic at the bottom causes filters to split and flood your mug of hot milk with grounds. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Weeze

customer_reviews.title: The best way to make coffee, but only for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I love this . Period. It’s great. No down side, and I am very particular about my coffee. I wrote the. Above review when I bought it . But the lever broke this AM, so had a lot of trouble making my coffee. Sorry, this wonderful product only lasted 5 months till it broke
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: A Pretty Good Cup of Coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Bonavita filter for a couple of weeks. It makes a pretty good cup of coffee. Unlike a previous reviewer, my wide base model doesn't leak at all, so I suspect that may have been a defective one. I use two heaping tablespoons of coffee, and the full filter creates almost the exact right amount for one large cup of coffee. The Aeropress still provides a tastier cup of coffee, but this is much less work on a day-to-day basis. Not a great cup of coffee, but good enough, and definitely as good as a cup of K-cup coffee for a lot less money per cup.
customer_reviews.author: QuirtEvans

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine doing pour-over using anything else. Beautifully finished ceramic with a reliable open/close function and lid so you can let it steep on your counter. Sturdy enough to use a regular water kettle. Easy to clean. Perfecto!
customer_reviews.author: PALMER DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Lever breaks
customer_reviews.text: As many others have said, the lever that opens and closes for the coffee to drip is going to break. Mine lasted 7 months. If you get one, be sure you have a back up plan so you don't find on the morning that you are running late for work the thing broke. I won't buy another one, but I wish there was a more durable option. I like the concept and the coffee was good.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Well and beautifully made...and superb control of water flow!
customer_reviews.text: This is porcelain filter system is really great....beautifully and well made with an excellent system for brewing until you're ready to let the hot water filter through...it also its better on the carafe and is very was to clean. I've bought 3 of the plastic filter units that control flow with a gravity valve...but all have broken after about a year of use...the hot water seems to erode the valve area...
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Over priced and poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and received this on December29. The plastic switch to close the bottom broke on February 19. Less than two months use and I only used it once or twice a week. The top of the product is porcelain but the bottom with the switch is plastic. The open /closed switch broke off. Also the lettering washed off as well. Just dissolved away. Don't buy this product. It is just a plain waste of money. I would have returned it but they only gave me 30 days on the return. The product broke approximately two weeks after that.
customer_reviews.author: Diana G.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months, company wouldn't refund or replace
customer_reviews.text: The gasket that prevents coffee from pre-maturely dripping out broke after ~6 months. The company told me it wasn't under warranty: " I’m sorry to hear of the issue you’ve experienced with your Bonavita immersion dripper. I apologize, the warranty period on this item has expired and we do not currently offer replacement parts for this. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause" I feel like a product I paid $38 for should last longer:
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Poor design choice for the most critical component
customer_reviews.text: The product has only 1 moving part: the plug on the bottom that opens and closes with a small lever. Unfortunately, this lever broke after barely 9 months of use. And, I did not even use it every day! See the photo of the broken part. Really too bad, as otherwise it is a fine product. However, due to the limited life of this critical component, I would not purchase this product-look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: katharine kates

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO CLEAN
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product and very easy to keep clean. I will always use single cup preparation coffee as there is no full pot of coffee to tempt me. I simply love coffee. This dripper makes it easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mlewis

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in many years
customer_reviews.text: I no longer use my drip machine or Kuerig machine to make coffee. The coffee tastes better than the drip machine and it does not generate the pods like the Kuerig machine. It does not all that much time to boil the water with the kettle. I also purchased a kettle that has a pour spout that comes off the bottom and a temperature sensor built into the lid so I know the water is very near 212 when I pour the water and I can accurately direct the water around the grounds in a circular motion with the long thin spout of the kettle.
customer_reviews.author: David C Watkins

customer_reviews.title: The only way that I make my coffee
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I spotted this on a lightning deal on Amazon one day! I had never heard of it before, but decided to give it a try. It is the only way that I make my coffee now. It makes all the difference when you can let the coffee grounds seep for 5 minutes before opening the little valve and letting the coffee pour into your mug! When you use a paper filter, there is absolutely no clean-up at all. You just dispose of the filter. The coffee turns out so great! I LOVE this dripper!
customer_reviews.author: A. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This works well, I would recommend being careful with the little plastic lever. It just seems like it could break from rough use or over time. Be nicer if it was metal or something.
customer_reviews.author: 20Amazon.Addict.20

customer_reviews.title: Lever broke just after one year (and outside waranty)...
customer_reviews.text: The lever to open and close the value broke after one year and three days. I contacted customer service about getting a better replacement lever and was told "... this part has not been upgraded. Replacement levers were offered for a period of time, but are no longer available." The entire product can be replaced under warranty but only for one year and ours broke one year and three days after purchase. This made nice enough coffee when it worked but clearly this is a defective design. I would avoid purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: ... maker for years and feel it really makes a good cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this drip coffee maker for years and feel it really makes a good cup of coffee. It's easy to use and I brew straight into my thermos mug. I find one usage fills my mug which is probably about a cup and a half. I did a lot of research before I bought my first one of these and this brand received very high reviews overall. I'm only buying a new one because I knocked my last one over and broke it :(.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality coffee maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the manual valve on this coffee maker, I have had one similar to this that had the valve also but it would open when you set it on the cup, the problem I had with it was on occasion after draining it into your cup and setting the coffee maker on the counter you could come back later to a puddle of coffee on the counter. This coffee maker has a positive shut off that doesn't leak, plus I like that it is made of porcelain easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Earl C. Lempke

customer_reviews.title: Best pour over coffee maker. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only device I've seen with an open/close option. It means that you can make your coffee as weak or strong as you want it. The top acts as a bottom - simple. Great instructions and cleans up in a second. Fill it up to the top and you have a one full cup of coffee. I hesitated because of the price, but it will pay for itself in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: jackiefab

customer_reviews.title: Best to stick with the standard pour over!
customer_reviews.text: It's not a perfect design! Because of the large amount of porcelain, it requires a lot of preheating to get an adequate brew. If you pour in water at 205F without preheating, your water will cool to under 150F in seconds, and you're not really brewing anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease use, easy cleaning and having a precise measure of water every time I make a cup of coffee. I make one large cup in the morning (15-16 oz). So far, so good. Does not sit perfectly flat on top of my mug, but doesn't slide around. My only concern is for the slide switch. I hope it holds up over the long haul. I doubt it is replaceable. That is why I took a star away on versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey John

customer_reviews.title: It works well. I deducted one star because it ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I deducted one star because it no longer has the retaining tabs on the bottom(like the previous version), which helps to keep it from sliding off the cup when accidentally bumped. On the other hand the flat bottom fits a wider variety sized cups
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee dripper
customer_reviews.text: The open/close tab helps modifying the brew strength. I've had it for almost 2 years, and it is still intact and working great. Easy to clean, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie J Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative to a French press.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this product. If you're looking for a product for making submersive coffee that has no plastic components coming in contact with the coffee then this is it!!!! Its a great alternative to a French press without all the tedious cleaning. I'm loving it!!!
customer_reviews.author: bindas

customer_reviews.title: Great product-Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. This is my second one. The old one has a crack after years of use. Glad to have a replacement at a bargain price. I only wash in the dishwasher occasionally to allow the plastic shut off valve a long life
customer_reviews.author: Jaymee777

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee but plastic will break
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these and I loved making coffee in them. Cleanup was super easy, and could get a stronger cup than a standard pour over. The plastic piece that opens/closes the pour spout broke on both of them within a week of each other. I threw them away before realizing I could have potentially got a free replacement piece. They lasted 9 months but I mostly only used one at a time, so heavy usage over 4.5 months was about the timeframe I got out of both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! For a pour-over coffee novice
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! For a pour-over coffee novice, you cannot beat this. It takes the guesswork out as you can keep the dripper on Close as long as you want (thus allowing the water to "steep", if you will) before sliding it to Open and allowing it to drip into your cup. I heat the water prior with an electric kettle so the entire process takes under 7 minutes. Makes a WAY better cup than any machine and provides the benefits of a filter that a coffee press doesn't. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Adams

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality, Total Control
customer_reviews.text: You decide how long to let the coffee steep, then hit the switch. I had the older model and it lasted 10 years. Gladly bought this as a replacement. My favorite way to make coffee.
customer_reviews.author: L. MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: I tried it out because it was ceramic but I like the functionality of my Clever Coffee Dripper (automatic release ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but didn't really float my boat. I tried it out because it was ceramic but I like the functionality of my Clever Coffee Dripper (automatic release when you set it on top of your coffee cup instead of a manual lever like this Bonavita) much better and I do believe I will be going back to that.
customer_reviews.author: BGG

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: You have to experiment with the amount of coffee to use. I'm still working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy B

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but flawed
customer_reviews.text: Just like a lot of the other reviewers, after just over a year of use, the lever for open/close broke. Even thought it's out of warranty, Bonavita support said submit a claim, we'll see if they replace it. I really wish they'd make some headway in fixing this. Bought a clever dripper in the mean time.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I thought the old version was good but had trouble on wide cups. This version works well with all sizes. I've tried a lot of cofee products and using this one is my favorite
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: Understand the warranty
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product, right up until the day that the little plastic lever in the front broke. It was still under warranty, so I submitted a claim, it was reviewed and approved, and shortly thereafter I received ... the little lever and some other parts. I was a bit surprised, as I had assumed that the unit would be replaced, not some components. But, I went ahead and repaired it myself. It leaked. I checked the repair, tried some adjustments, and ... it leaked. My wife, for whom this had been purchased, stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny Steele

customer_reviews.title: I love it, because it's ceramic but it's ceramic so ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it, because it's ceramic but it's ceramic so it's already cracked from dropping! the on and off feature worked great, except that I forgot to turn it to off after using sometimes. Debating whether to order another one to replace it since it's not cheap and I'm still accident prone! I would recommend to anyone who doesn't like anything plastic especially when using with hot liquids.
customer_reviews.author: heidi402

customer_reviews.title: Plastic portion broke
customer_reviews.text: I also hoped that the issue was fixed--but mine only lasted 6 months. This morning the lever broke. Darn! I like the ceramic upper, but apparently it is a no go with the lever. They haven't fixed the long term problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nreader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for single-cup coffee brewing.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Makes a perfect cup of coffee. I use almost-boiling water and let it sit covered for over a minute, and then flip the switch. Works great with my Ember ceramic mug and #4 filters.
customer_reviews.author: customer9999

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new pour over!! It is so easy to use and the coffee is delicious!
customer_reviews.author: sharon mays

customer_reviews.title: This makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great cup of coffee. Since I use it daily, it's an easier cleanup process than the french press. As another reviewer had mentioned, the porcelain cup keeps the coffee hot. My only concern would be the carnage of broken porcelain when my clumsy arms whips it across the room. Otherwise, I highly recommend (to non-accident prone users).
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very dissatisfied. I bought this in March and liked it a lot. However it's already broken. The plastic piece that controls whether the funnel is open or closed is broken. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen E. Duffy

customer_reviews.title: broke less than two weeks after I received it
customer_reviews.text: I waited two months to receive this and was initally delighted but after two weeks of twice a day use, the lever that opens and closes the coffee dripper broke and it is not useless.
customer_reviews.author: mary horowitz

customer_reviews.title: Great ... with one improvement
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and makes great coffee. But when the release lever broke, I discovered that a replacement was nearly as much as the whole unit. That's a real shame.
customer_reviews.author: VASS

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after a year of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Bonavita dripper in September 2014. It worked great right up until the one-year mark. Now the stopper at the bottom doesn't seal. Coffee leaks out when the lever is in the "close" position. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Creates a brew between an immersion and a straight drip. Not quite as easy as say a Melita, but not as skill-heavy as a v60. Currently my favorite brew method (I have a Melita, a chemex, a v60, an aeropress, and a French press). Biggest downside is that it really only makes a single cup
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camping coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping coffee. Let the water steep for 5 minutrs
customer_reviews.author: NYMTB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful thing. For drip-through coffee, it is the best. Adding Sugru knobs to the on/off slider is a help, but not necessary for fine operation. We use one every day, and have given them away as house presents -- all were very appreciated. Highest recommendation.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Bonita for about a year, but only started using it this summer...after a month of daily use the switch for opening and closing the flow broke off in my hand. This was the feature that I bought the dripper for! So disappointing. I thought Bonita was high quality.

customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but also easy to forget to close the lever at the bottom. We had several messes at the beginning until we got used to that! The lettering wore off pretty quickly on the bottom too so we just need to remember that left is open and right is closed.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Goda

customer_reviews.title: Valve broke
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these that I’ve bought in two months. The valve on the first one broke rendering it useless. We’ll see how the second one does.
customer_reviews.author: speeder

customer_reviews.title: Good, but breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: Works well until the cheap open/close switch breaks. Switch broke within 2 months of use, after the Amazon return window closed. Bonavita’s customer service is nonexistent. Unable to replace or repair.

customer_reviews.title: but I had to get it as I am a strong coffee addict and no filter works better at concentrating your brew
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Bonavita filter, the 1st was knocked over and the porcelain cracked making it unusable. Unfortunately, the price went up, but I had to get it as I am a strong coffee addict and no filter works better at concentrating your brew!
